items.sentence: I thought I\'d made my feelings about Tom perfectly clear.
I wasn\'t very sleepy, so I stayed up and watched a movie.
I\'d like you to go to the supermarket and buy some bread.
I didn\'t say anything because I didn\'t know what to say.
I didn\'t tell Tom why I wasn\'t going to be at his party.
As is often the case with him, he didn\'t show up on time.
Tom certainly didn\'t do as good a job as he usually does.
Tom is convinced that his mother doesn\'t want to eat now.
Tom knew Mary wouldn\'t even consider coming over to help.
I never for a moment imagined that Tom would be convicted.
I trained my dog to bring me the newspaper in the morning.
Give me a few minutes and I\'ll find out what\'s going on.
There\'s only one way to find out how to do that. Ask Tom.
These flowers aren\'t only beautiful, but they smell nice.
I\'d be very surprised if Tom isn\'t at the party tonight.
It\'s been a long time since we\'ve had such nice weather.
Could you please take care of my dog while I\'m in Boston?
Do you know what to do if there\'s a fire in the building?
Tom and I aren\'t the only ones here who can speak French.
I wish I could come up with a good answer to the question.
I wish I could explain to you how important this is to me.
I wonder whether Tom has ever asked Mary why she did that.
I\'ll send you a copy of that picture as soon as possible.
I\'m afraid we must go if we want to get home before dark.
I\'m meeting Tom for lunch at a restaurant on Park Street.
I\'m not interested in learning how to fix a broken table.
I\'m very interested in listening to what you have to say.
I\'ve already written everything that needs to be written.
I don\'t care what anyone says. I think Tom is a nice guy.
I don\'t have time to do everything that needs to be done.
I don\'t have time to say this twice, so listen carefully.
I don\'t know what Tom told you, but it might not be true.
I don\'t really want to wear a tie to work, but I have to.
I don\'t think Tom knows what time I woke up this morning.
You\'re one of the most interesting people I\'ve ever met.
Tom didn\'t want to go outside without his hat and gloves.
Tom has gone to get a haircut, but he should be back soon.
Tom played the oboe and Mary accompanied him on the piano.
Tom ran and ran, until at last he saw the telephone booth.
Tom worked in the garden for several hours this afternoon.
Why don\'t you do something useful and get me some coffee?
You can come and see me whenever it\'s convenient for you.
You have wanted to go there for a long time, haven\'t you?
I haven\'t told the kids yet that we\'re getting divorced.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom and Mary don\'t know each other.
I\'m the only one in this group who doesn\'t speak French.
Tom said he wanted me to be at the meeting this afternoon.
Tom takes a shower every morning before he goes to school.
Tom never expected that Mary would fall in love with John.
Tom never forgave himself for hurting Mary the way he did.
Tom never really wanted to become a professional musician.
Tom noticed that all the other boys were wearing neckties.
Tom only had one pair of socks and they had holes in them.
Tom opened his suitcase again and put some more things in.
Do you think that eating breakfast every day is important?
Do you think you could handle that kind of responsibility?
Do you want something to eat before your meeting with Tom?
Does Tom still want to stay in Boston with us next summer?
Tom used to go to Boston every summer when he was a child.
Will Tom be allowed to go camping with the other children?
Tom doesn\'t think that Mary\'s performance was very good.
Tom asked me to buy a dozen eggs on my way home from work.
Tom ate the chocolate chip cookies that Mary made for him.
Tom became friends with Mary when he was living in Boston.
Tom bought a new car with the money he won in the lottery.
Tom brought his car to the repair shop to have it checked.
There was a banner on the wall that said "Happy Birthday."
They announced the date of their wedding in the newspaper.
I think it\'s dangerous for children to swim in this lake.
I\'ve heard that Boston is a very expensive place to live.
Tom is not only unhappy at work, but also unhappy at home.
Tom knew who Mary said she was planning to get married to.
Tom probably bought it with the money his father gave him.
Tom put the popcorn into the pan and waited for it to pop.
Tom didn\'t know Mary wasn\'t going to be able to do that.
Tom didn\'t know how to accept Mary\'s love and affection.
Tom didn\'t know the reason why Mary couldn\'t go bowling.
Mary was annoyed with Tom, and wouldn\'t return his calls.
Mary\'s smiling face let everyone know that she was happy.
Tom\'s yacht is one of the largest yachts I\'ve ever seen.
Tom remained in his car while Mary was in the supermarket.
Tom rented a truck to move his furniture to his new house.
Tom rolled up the poster and put it into a cardboard tube.
Tom said he wants to buy either flowers or candy for Mary.
I often read the newspaper while I\'m waiting for the bus.
I think that I\'ve already spoken to everybody about that.
I wasn\'t as interested in doing that as Tom seemed to be.
I wasn\'t surprised when Tom told me he wanted to do that.
I needed your help on something, but I couldn\'t find you.
Is there any place around here where I can rent a bicycle?
Make sure that the lights are turned off before you leave.
Tom said that he and Mary would probably be a little late.
Tom and Mary promised me that they\'d never do that again.
Tom doesn\'t have to talk about it if he doesn\'t want to.
Is there something in your room you don\'t want me to see?
Didn\'t you know Tom lived in Australia when he was a kid?
This is a sentence that has the syllable count of a haiku.
Tom accused Mary of stealing his money, but she denied it.
Tom adds a little money to his savings account each month.
Tom admitted that he always has trouble remembering names.
